title: Six people, including a 14-year-old boy, are shot when gunman opens fire in Philadelphia drive-by
text:
Six people were shot, the youngest a 14-year-old boy, when a gunman opened fire in Philadelphia - the sixth shooting to take place in one weekend.

The latest, a drive-by shooting, happened on Sunday at 5:24 pm local time. Police received a 911 call with reports of gunshots and several victims at 8th Street and Clearfield Street.

Acting Philadelphia Police Commissioner Christine Coulter said, at a local media briefing, the shooting was likely a drive-by.

She said police had been scouring the area for evidence and found minimal shell casings on the street, leading her to believe the shooter fired from a car.

The six victims all survived and were being treated at the Temple University Hospital for a range of injuries.

Police have been scouring the area where the shooting took place around 8th Street and Clearfield Street on Sunday evening

The youngest had been shot in the right hand; the oldest victim a 27-year-old had been shot in the right hip and the right foot. Both victims were reportedly stable.

Family members identified the 14-year-old as Quaseen Thompson, 6 ABC reported

'So far, he's doing good,' said a family member.

A 21-year-old was shot in the left shoulder and a 22-year-old was shot in the chest - both were also stable, police said.

Two other men, aged 20, had also been shot and were in surgery - the extent of their injuries remain unknown at this stage.

Four were in a stable condition and two were in surgery on Sunday evening.

No arrests have been made, and a weapon has not been found, police said.

6 ABC reporter Annie McCormick was at the scene. In a video she shared on Twitter she described how residents heard at least 14 shots being fired.

'We also heard from an 8-year-old girl who said she was inside a bodega, when those shots were fired. She said she was terrified, she hit the ground, they locked the door of the bodega and she waited for her grandmother to come and get her and bring her to safety.'

UPDATE: From Temple Hospital. PPD says the 6 victims range in ages 14-27 all suffered non life threatening injuries. The drive-by shooting at 8/Clearfield happened 5:30 pm. No arrests. @6abc pic.twitter.com/jALZuuDwQD — Annie McCormick (@6abcAnnie) October 14, 2019

The drive-by was the latest in a string of shootings that has seen two men killed and seven injured over the weekend.

In one shooting on Friday evening a 27-year-old was shot in the neck and killed in the city's King Village.

Another, early on Saturday morning left a 22-year-old dead and three others injured in northern Philadelphia.

Police told local media they were two shooters in the early morning quadruple shooting, one of whom was likely to have used a military-style rifle.

Residents in the area of the latest drive-by told the Philadelphia Inquirer gun violence was a regular part of life.

'It's normal to us. Sad to say, but it's normal,' said Tasha Barlow, 23.

'There's a lot of shootings around here,' said her 13-year-old nephew, Juan Rodriguez. 'I'm just used to it. We hear it all the time.'

Barlow, a bus attendant, who lived half a block from the shooting said many of the disagreements were over drugs.

'I just mind my business and don't come outside,' she said. 'It's like you have to keep going. It happens every day and there's nothing you can do about it. Sure it's hard for him [Juan] to see but it's life. It shouldn't be but it is.'

Two other unidentified men walking up Eighth Street said the news of the shooting was not out of the ordinary.

'It's the hood,' said one. 'There are shootings here every other week.'
description: Police received a 911 call with reports of gunshots and several victims at 8th Street and Clearfield Street at 5:24 on Sunday evening. It was the sixth shooting in a single weekend in Philadelphia.
